required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluating the Performance of Precision1 Daily Disposable Contact Lens in a Group of Heavy Digital Device Users
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluating the Performance of Precision1 Daily Disposable Contact Lens in a Group of Heavy Digital Device Users

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the performance of Precision1 DD CLs with regard to subjective symptoms (dryness, comfort, vision), lens fit and time to haze in CL wearers who identify themselves as heavy digital devices users (at least 6 hours of digital device use per day).

primary_outcome.measure: Subjective comfort after contact lens insertion
primary_outcome.description: Participants rate their comfort after insertion on a scale from 0 (worst) to 100 (best).

primary_outcome.measure: Subjective dryness after contact lens insertion
primary_outcome.description: Participants rate their dryness after insertion on a scale from 0 (worst) to 100 (best).

primary_outcome.measure: Subjective rating of clarity of vision after contact lens insertion
primary_outcome.description: Participants rate their clarity of vision after insertion on a scale from 0 (worst) to 100 (best).

primary_outcome.description: Participants rate their comfort after insertion on a scale from 0 (worst) to 100 (best).

arm_group.description: Refit and dispense patient with Verofilcon A contact lenses and evaluate lens performance.

intervention.description: Daily disposable silicone hydrogel contact lenses indicated for the optical correction of refractive ametropia (myopia and hyperopia)
